{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pott's puffy tumor is mentioned in multiple documents. It is described as a subperiosteal abscess of the frontal bone associated with osteomyelitis, usually seen as a complication of frontal sinusitis. It is not described as a malignant tumor, an extradural abscess, a tumor of the pituitary gland, or an adrenal gland tumor.", "answer_choice": "B"}
